title: Synthetic Recap
body:
ATLANTA — On a night where defense reigned and points were at a premium, one man staged an offensive clinic for the ages. Dikembe Mutombo, the Atlanta Hawks’ towering center, didn’t just anchor his team’s paint; he carried them to victory with a superhuman rebounding performance, pulling down a staggering **31 rebounds** in an 86-75 defensive slugfest against the Los Angeles Lakers.

In a game where neither team could crack 90 points, every possession was a battle. The Lakers, led by Shaquille O’Neal’s 26 points and 19 rebounds, fought hard in the trenches. But they were powerless to stop Mutombo’s historic dominance on the glass. His 31 boards were an unstoppable force, snuffing out second chances and fueling the Atlanta offense with new life time and again. Each rebound was a statement, punctuated by Mutombo’s trademark finger wag.

While Steve Smith provided the scoring punch with a game-high 29 points, the narrative was written entirely by Mutombo’s relentless work in the paint. He amassed more rebounds than the entire Lakers starting frontcourt combined, a testament to his sheer will and positional mastery. His 13 points were a mere footnote to his gargantuan effort on the boards.

The Hawks, leveraging Mutombo’s historic night, grinded down the Lakers, holding them to a frigid 75 points. In an era defined by physicality, this was a masterpiece of defensive basketball, with one man at its epicenter. Dikembe Mutombo didn’t just win a game; he authored a rebounding performance for the history books, a singular, dominant force that the Lakers simply could not overcome.
